title: Not to imply Guinsoo's isn't OP but
body:
you can't really complain about the fact that it's cost efficient.

For a hybrid item to be viable its base stats HAVE to be cost efficient since they don't benefit each other.

A standard item, botrk for example gives 3 stats: AD, AS, and lifesteal all of which make the other stats that come with it more valuable. More autoattacks means you're getting more out of your AD and it also means you're lifestealing more often.

In contrast, getting AP doesn't make your AD more valuable and while technically AS does make AP more valuable with the 8 stack on-hit passive, practically it doesn't matter that much (unless you're kayle with nashors).

The item is 68% gold efficient at no stacks going up to almost 200% at 8 stacks.

Riot actually did a good job conceptually of tying the efficiency of the item to time spent in battle.

The problem is that for melees, it's too easy to reach that peak and for ranged, it's very easy to maintain stacks given that they only go away after 5 seconds.

So I do think that if Riot did away with melee autoattacks generating 2 stacks of rage and decreased the grace period from 5 seconds to something like 2 seconds it would go a long way towards the item being balanced.

If you nerf the efficiency you might as well remove the item from the game since that's all it has going for it, so I hope Riot takes the correct steps towards balancing the item or outright deletes it. It's annoying when Riot makes an item, it's popular for a bit, then nerfs what made it worth buying in the first place, and then no one buys it for the rest of the season after which it gets deleted or reworked.
